name: Tim Boomer
bio: Natural history photographer with a special interest in California's tiny treasures.

social_posts.post_text:
I met Purdy's fritillary (Fritillaria purdyi) for the first time four years ago, but we have since become good friends. 😊

#wildflowerwednesday #purdysfritillary #fritillariapurdyi #fritillaria #fritillary #lily #liliaceae #botany #nativeplants #wildplants #rareplant #focusstacking #wideanglemacro

Happy #MycoheterotrophMonday to all the flora fans out there!  Today's botanical beauty is Pacific coralroot (Corallorhiza mertensiana). If you swipe to the wide-angle view, you will notice that the entire plant is devoid of green.  That's because this orchid does not photosynthesize, but instead derives nutrients from nearby fungi.

For comparison, I've included old photos of spotted coralroot (C. maculata) and striped coralroot (C. striata), both of which are also mycoheterotrophs.  There is a fourth coralroot, C. trifida, which is extremely rare in California and has eluded me for several years.  If anyone is willing to share any knowledge of its whereabouts beyond what can be found in the Calflora records, I would be very grateful.  Cheers!

#pacificcoralroot #corallorhizamertensiana #coralroot #mycoheterotroph #mycotroph #orchid #orchis #orchidaceae #wildorchids #wildplants #nativeplants #californianativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #laowa100mm #nikon200mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all!  Here's a fun forest find known as California groundcone (Kopsiopsis strobilacea). It's non-photosynthesizing, just like last week's Pacific coralroot.  However, the groundcone is not a mycoheterotroph because it does not rely on fungi for nutrients.  Instead, it directly parasitizes nearby manzanitas and madrones.  It's such a cool plant, and one I was happy to finally see in bloom a couple of weeks ago!

#nosunrequired 😎 #californiagroundcone #kopsiopsisstrobilacea #boschniakiastrobilacea #nonphotosynthetic #wildplants #nativeplants #californianativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #nikon200mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all!  I finally had a chance to check off a bucket list species this year - the calico monkeyflower (Diplacus pictus)! This California endemic has such a beautiful pattern, and all those glandular hairs on the leaves and stem are icing on the cake.  If you swipe to the second photo taken at 2x, you can see more of those glandular hairs on the lower petal and inside the corolla tube - so cool!  The final photo shows my pinkie for scale.  I don't have enormous fingers, so that's about twice as big as the actual size, depending on your screen.  I've been fortunate enough to photograph a couple more monkeyflower species this spring, so I'm afraid you will have to put up with more of my monkey business in the weeks to come. 🙈 Cheers!

#calicomonkeyflower #diplacuspictus #diplacus #monkeyflower #rareplants #californiaendemic #wildplants #nativeplants #californianativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #nikon200mm #laowa100mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus

For #MycologyMonday, here's a new photo of a species I've posted a couple of times before - swamp beacon (Mitrula elegans). I showed this picture to my 10-year-old son last night and explained that these mushrooms grow in wetlands, such as bogs and fens.  Without missing a beat, he excitedly declared them "marsh-rooms." Now why didn't I think of that?!

He then proceeded to ask what the differences were between a swamp and a marsh, but I think he was just trying to delay bedtime at that point.  There are differences indeed, but I wouldn't get too bogged down with the details, especially if you're already swamped. 😉

#swampbeacon #mitrulaelegans #bogbeacon #mitrula #naturepuns #naturenerd #wildmushrooms #californiamushrooms #mushroommonday #focusstacking #heliconfocus #nikon200mm

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all! As promised, the monkey business continues - this time with the purplelip pansy monkeyflower (Diplacus angustatus). The first photo is a composite of 105 exposures at twice lifesize.

If you're wondering why it looks like a disembodied flower surrounded by a creamy blur, it's because the "face" of the flower extends well above the rest of the plant on an incredibly long and skinny corolla tube. At 2x, the relatively distant background is thrown completely out of focus.

In the second photo, you can see the entire plant. To me, it looks like she's singing to the sky, along with a small group of backup singers. 🤩

The third photo shows my finger for scale. This is not a large flower, but I am always amazed by how much detail and intricacy can be contained in such a small area! If you want to see more of those details, feel free to swipe to the crop video at the end.  Cheers!

#purplelippansymonkeyflower #diplacusangustatus #diplacus #monkeyflower #weewednesday #californiaendemic #californianativeplants #wildplants #nativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #nikon200mm #laowa100mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus #plumasnationalforest

Did someone lose their jewelry in the forest? On this #SlimeMoldSunday, I'm pleased to present the most beautifully iridescent Prototrichia I've ever seen!  No saturation added - just plenty of light and a bunch of frames stacked together to get the whole subject in focus.  Swipe for a crop to get a closer look at this sparkly spectacle, and swipe again for a short behind-the-scenes video.

In the video, you can see the snow nearby, which makes this a nivicolous species.  And as I zoom in to one of the frames on my camera, you can see just how little of the subject is in focus at 10x magnification. If you look closely at the little piece of wood that I pick up, there are two fruiting bodies - a larger, typically sized one towards the back, and the tiny one in the middle, which is the subject of this photo.  So much beauty in such a small package!

#slimemold #slimemould #prototrichia #prototrichiametallica #prototrichiaschroeteri #nivicolous #iridescent #sporangia #myxomycetes #myxo #notafungus #extrememacro #focusstacking #heliconfocus #nikon200mm #mitutoyo10x

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all!  Okay, just this last monkeyflower, and then I'll move on.  This one's called purple mouse ears (Diplacus douglasii), and it's hard to imagine a more adorable little flower. Feel free to swipe for some different perspectives, as these beauties look great from all angles. Cheers! 🐭

#purplemouseears #diplacusdouglasii #diplacus #mimulusdouglasii #brownies #monkeyflower #weewednesday #wildplants #nativeplants #californianativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #nikon200mm #wideanglemacro #focusstacking #heliconfocus

Wildflower season is in full swing, but there are still mushrooms to be found if you look in the right places - in this case, a damp log near snowmelt in the Sierra.  Swipe for a crop tour and a behind the scenes video if you wish.  Focus-stacked composite of 128 one-second exposures under natural light.  Cheers!

#Arrheniaepichysium #gillsfordays #forestfinds #forestfloor #mycology #wildmushrooms #californiamushrooms #weewednesday #focusstacking #heliconfocus #laowa100mm

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all the lily lovers out there! This gorgeous species is known as Kellogg's lily (Lilium kelloggii). It had been on my wishlist for a number of years, and I'm so thrilled that I finally got to see it in person. I'm also thankful for the opportunity to smell it with my own nose, as its scent is absolutely heavenly.

Huge thanks to @maryannmachi and @chrisophylla for helpful tips finding this very special plant! 

#kelloggslily #liliumkelloggii #rareplants #wildplants #nativeplants #californianativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #petalpusher #botany #nikon200mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus

Happy #TinyTuesday to all who appreciate nature's smallest details!  Here is a little butterfly egg that I found in my garden a couple of weeks ago.  It just looks like a yellow dot to the naked eye, but with the aid of a microscope objective, beautiful patterns are revealed.  In this case, I used the new Laowa Aurogon FF 10-50X NA0.5 supermicro APO, which @venuslaowa was kind enough to let me try out.  Feel free to swipe for a crop for even more details and a cellphone shot for scale.  Cheers!

P.S. Big thanks to @robber_fly for ID assistance! I believe the egg is likely from a duskywing butterfly (Erynnis sp.).
 
[Focus-stacked composite of 181 exposures with flash at 10x lifesize]

#butterflyegg #erynnis #egg #extrememacro #focusstacking #heliconfocus #photomicrography #laowa #laowaaurogon #aurogon #venuslaowa

Have you ever seen this delightful little leaf treasure?  It's a 3mm disc gall induced by the cynipid wasp, Andricus parmula.  You can read more about how galls are formed in my previous #CynipidSaturday posts if you're interested, but today I am excited to announce that this is my first ever stacked and stitched micro panorama!  It is a "stitched" composite of six separate photos, each of which is a focus-stacked composite of ~150 exposures taken at 7.5x lifesize.  The result is an ultra-high-resolution file with microscopic details that still has the overview composition of a lower magnification lens.  Apologies if that all sounds like gibberish! Swipe for a crop and a scale shot if you wish.  Cheers!

P.S. The blue background is from the plastic clothespin I used to stabilize the leaf, but I hoped it would simulate a blue sky. 😆

#discgallwasp #andricusparmula #gall #plantgall #oakgall #cynipid #cynipidae #gallphotography #cecidology #CecidologySaturday #sciencephotography #entomology #biology #biodiversity #naturalhistory #naturenerd #focusstacking #heliconfocus #mitutoyo7.5x

Happy #SlimeMoldSunday to all!  Here's another nivicolous (snowmelt) species I found in the mountains over the summer, likely Comatricha fusiformis.  This unusually shaped specimen reminds me of a carefully balanced avocado jellybean. 😆 Cheers!

#comatrichafusiformis #nivicolous #iridescent #myxomycetes #myxo #notafungus #extrememacro #focusstacking #heliconfocus #nikon200mm #mitutoyo10x #eldoradonationalforest

Happy #WildflowerWednesday to all! I thought I was all done posting monkeyflowers for the year, but...surprise, here's another one! This is Brewer's monkeyflower (Erythranthe breweri), an itty-bitty treasure that is quite easy to miss when you're out hiking in the high country.  The first photo is a focus-stacked composite of 96 exposures at lifesize.  The second photo is made from 71 exposures at 5x lifesize.

"Lifesize" means that the subject is recorded at its actual size on the camera sensor.  And 5x means that this 3.6mm-wide flower is magnified to 18mm wide on the sensor.  Of course, you're viewing these pictures on a screen that is larger than a camera sensor, so the scale shot at the end is probably the easiest way to appreciate the size of this flower. 😆

#monkeyflower #erythranthebreweri #weewednesday #californianativeplants #wildplants #nativeplants #californiawildflowers #wildflowers #flora #botany #nikon200mm #laowa25mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus #extrememacro #eldoradonationalforest

Greetings to my fellow seekers of tiny treasures!  I don't typically repost old pictures, but today I am absolutely thrilled to have two of my photos recognized in the 49th annual Nikon Small World Photomicrography Competition! 🔬🔬🔬

The first photo of Comatricha slime mold was awarded 6th place, and the second photo of Didymium slime mold was awarded an image of distinction.  It is such an honor to have my photos in the company of such incredible imagery from all over the world. 🙆 Cheers!

#nikonsmallworld @nikoninstruments #comatricha #comatrichanigra #didymium #slimemold #slimemould #myxomycetes #notafungus #photomicrography #extrememacro #macrophotography #mitutoyo10x #focusstacking #heliconfocus

My daughter and I collected some old sticks the other day and placed them in the bird bath in our garden. The bird bath filled up and soaked the sticks after a bit of rain, and some Comatricha slime molds started popping up a couple of days later.  I noticed this one in the morning while the plasmodium was still making its way up the stalk.  It was pink and spherical by the afternoon, and black in the evening.  The pink stage is my favorite, but I thought I'd post this little developing "light bulb" for a change.  Cheers!

#comatricha #comatrichanigra #slimemold #slimemould #slimemoldsunday #myxomycetes #notafungus #photomicrography #extrememacro #macrophotography #mitutoyo10x #nikon200mm #focusstacking #heliconfocus

The rainy season has finally started in my area, which means that I have something new to share for #FungiFriday - the slimy purple-stemmed cort (likely Cortinarius seidliae)! This is a mushroom I've photographed before, but it was still high on my wishlist this year because it's just so beautiful.  Do you see those colors?! Swipe for a crop if you wish, and swipe again for a short video showing how slimy this species is.  The reflections on the cap are a little overwhelming for my photographic taste, so I covered the scene with a large diffuser to tame them.  Focus-stacked composite of 42 five-second exposures.  Cheers!

#slimypurplestemmedcort #cortinariusseidliae #cortinarius #mycology #forestfinds #forestfloor #fungusfriday #californiamushrooms #wildmushrooms #focusstacking #heliconfocus

I found this lovely pair of developing Hemitrichia fruiting bodies on a hike in the forest last month.  The bright orange color is what initially caught my attention, but it's those intricate crystalline stalks which fascinate me the most.  I photographed them in the woods with a 7.5x Mitutoyo microscope objective and combined about 200 exposures to get everything in focus.  Cheers!

#hemitrichia #hemitrichiadecipiens likely #shiny #slimemoldsunday #slimemold #slimemould #myxomycetes #myxo #notafungus #extrememacro #focusstacking #heliconfocus #nikon200mm #mitutoyo 7.5x
Natural history photographer with a special interest in California's tiny treasures.
